title: Brighton rock = Young scareface. Eight o'clock walk
creator_credit: Associated British Picture Corporation, British Lion Corporation, Roy Boulting, George King, John Boulting and Lance Comfort
brief_description: A double bill feature. “Brighton Rock” written by Graham Greene is a post-war thriller starring Richard Attenborough as Pinkie, a hoodlum. Pinkie marries a young waitress as his alibi for murder, then tries to get rid of her and a rival gang intervenes. “Eight O’clock walk” once again stars Attenborough in the title role as a taxi driver falsely accused of the murder of a little girl and his struggle with his wife to prove his innocence. A courtroom drama with excellent performances.
